entries.content: Use a permission-based opening on cold calls to immediately disarm the prospect.
Ask for permission to hang up early in the call.
entries.notes: Phrasing like 'give me permission... to hang up on me'

entries.content: Offer the prospect control at the very beginning of the interaction.
entries.notes: This helps reduce perceived threat and resistance.

entries.content: If the prospect says 'yes' to hanging up, respect their decision and end the call.
A permission-based opening acts as a psychological pattern interrupt.
entries.notes: It breaks from the prospect's expectation of a typical sales pitch.

entries.content: Phrasing the permission request negatively ('permission to hang up') can be a stronger pattern interrupt than a positive frame ('permission to continue').
Making prospects feel safe and less threatened increases the likelihood they will listen.
The permission-based opening should be delivered within the first five seconds of the call.
This technique aims to break through initial resistance and get into a conversation.
